title: Perth Mother Charged With Murder Of Daughters, Aged 6 And 10
text:
Perth mother Milka Djurasovic has been charged with the murder of her two daughters Mia, 10, and Tiana, 6, two days after being found at a beach near her Madeley home with self-inflicted injuries.

Djurasovic has been in police custody in a Perth hospital since she was discovered at Whitfords Beach on Friday evening with non-life threatening wounds.

Mia and Tiana had been discovered dead in their home by their father Nenad Djurasovic in their home in Bogdanich Way, Madeley, three hours earlier when he returned home from work.

Police released a written statement saying they have charged the girls' mother with two counts of murder.

WA Police said they were called to the family home after calls from neighbours saying they heard screaming.

Assistant Commissioner Paul Steel said on Saturday the incident was a heartbreaking case for all involved.

"This is a tragic event and our heartfelt condolences go out to the friends and family of these children," he told reporters.

"Heartbreaking events like this not only have impact on those directly involved, the friends and family of those children, but on the wider community of Western Australia.

"Our thoughts are also with those first responders who discovered the bodies of those children and also for the forensic officers and the homicide investigators who will be working their way meticulously through this crime scene for the coming days and weeks."

Neighbour Gordana Sousak said that the girls' father found one of the bodies on Friday afternoon, before calling police, who told him not to go any further into the house.

"It’s just a shock, [the family] are devastated," Sousak told WA Today.

"[The grandfather] told me his son came home from work to find his little girl dead on the floor.

"When he called police they told him not to touch her, but by that time he'd found the other little girl in the laundry."

The cause of Mia and Tiana's death is still being investigated by police and medical experts.

Their mother will face Stirling Gardens Magistrate's Court on Monday.
